head.supplied: 25 Sep 93 ¶ From ¶ Melbourne 10.50 ¶ for ¶ Hy. Tryon ¶ ¶ Would be at peril of my life to travel at present suffering from severe bronchitis with complications telegraphed about honorable augustus g...

div.p: UQFL 2/1838, Fryer Library, University of Queensland, Brisbane.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: Would be at peril of my life to travel at present suffering from severe bronchitis with complications telegraphed about honorable augustus gregory to professor tate in Eulogistic words suggesting goyder nominator perhaps requisitors will send approving telegram to adelaide & suggest seconder

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Baron Von Mueller
It was reported at the meeting of the Australasian Association for the Advancement of Science held in Adelaide, 25 September–3 October 1893, that it had been intended that Sir Samuel Griffith, Chief Justice of Qld, would be nominated as President of the Association for the next meeting, to be held in Brisbane in January 1895. At the last minute, however, Griffith withdrew and Augustus Gregory was elected President for the Brisbane meeting instead (see the Report of the meeting, p. xix). See also J. Thomson to M, 5 October 1893.
